Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre, above two white lines; exterior: lion (rump and tail remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Hayes compares this sherd with the Tocra Type III.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 293, no. 917, pl. 122)
Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 206-7, no. N15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1172) (phase 2)
